message.content:
cs.CL, cs.IR, cs.LG, cs.SI, cs.AI. 

This paper deals with aspect extraction from reviews, which is a common task in natural language processing and information retrieval. The paper proposes a neural model for aspect extraction and evaluates it on two practical tasks related to review summarization and user profiling. Therefore, the most likely sub-category is cs.CL (Computation and Language), which deals with natural language processing and computational linguistics. The paper also involves machine learning and data mining techniques, which are relevant to sub-categories such as cs.IR (Information Retrieval), cs.LG (Machine Learning), and cs.AI (Artificial Intelligence). Finally, the paper evaluates the proposed model on the basis of user preferences and review rankings, which could be relevant to sub-category cs.SI (Social and Information Networks).
